Source code for havoc.autoval.e2e_tests.test_config_check.test_config_check

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.config_check import ConfigCheck



[docs]class TestConfigCheck(TestBase):


[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("host unit test")

        host_info = self.hosts[0]

        # Standard host creation
        host = Host(host_info)
        self.validate_no_exception(
            host.run, ["hostname"], "connected to host %s" % (host.hostname)
        )

        bios_dmi_start = host.bios.get_bios_full_info()
        bios_dmi_end = host.bios.get_bios_full_info()
        bios_dmi_end[1]['handle'] = 4
        self.diff_bios_dmidecode(bios_dmi_start, bios_dmi_end)



[docs]    def diff_bios_dmidecode(self, start_info, end_info):
        config_check = ConfigCheck()
        start_filtered = config_check.filter_dmidecode(start_info)
        end_filtered = config_check.filter_dmidecode(end_info)
        # diff = AutovalUtils.compare_configs(start_filtered, end_filtered)
        AutovalUtils.validate_equal(
            start_filtered,
            end_filtered,
            "bios dmidecode output comparison between two versions"
        )




[docs]def main():
    test = TestConfigCheck()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
